name: crc1607_sample_v1_id
displayName: Self-defined sample ID(s). Make sure enter the same ID when entering the assay metadata.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_organism
displayName: The species from which the sample was obtained.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_type
displayName: A description of the physical nature of the sample.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_cellline
displayName: The name or identifier of the cell line used, if applicable.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_animalinfo
displayName: Biological condition of animal sample source.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_model
displayName: The specific model of animal, if applicable.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_gene
displayName: The name of the gene being studied.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_age
displayName: Age of the animal model or the human subject at the time of sample collection.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_disease
displayName: Studied disease or condition. If not in the list, select Other and fill it in the next field.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_stage
displayName: The developmental or disease stage of the sample source.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_relateid
displayName: Other samples as control, treatment group or from the same animal model.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_protocol
displayName: If you would like to share the sample preparation protocol, please enter the link here. This can be an external repository or an internal path to a shared folder.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_relvpaper
displayName: Link or DOI of the literature that is relevant to the sample preparation method.

name: crc1607_sample_v1_notes
displayName: Notes about sample preparation or modification of protocol. Either for fellow researchers or to metadata provider in the future.
